w:r.w:t: A Graph-Native Memory Architecture for Persistent Large Language Model Systems

Large Language Models (LLMs) demonstrate advanced generative reasoning yet lack persistent, structured memory. Existing augmentation techniques rely primarily on vector similarity over unstructured text, resulting in weak relational reasoning, limited temporal awareness, hallucination risk, and escalating token costs.

MemoryKeep introduces a graph-native cognitive memory architecture for persistent AI systems. It models memory as a typed, provenance-aware, confidence-scored property graph with hybrid structural and semantic retrieval. The architecture enforces strict token governance, supports deterministic reboot recovery, and enables explainable recall through path-based reasoning.
MemoryKeep transforms stateless language models into structured, persistent cognitive systems suitable for enterprise, long-running agents, and AI infrastructure deployment.
LLMs operate within bounded context windows and do not inherently maintain persistent memory across sessions. Common augmentation strategies rely on:
These techniques treat memory as text. They do not model:
Persistent AI requires structured memory infrastructure.

The system does not persist raw conversation logs as memory.
MemoryKeep uses a directed, typed property graph.
Patterns are stored as explicit graph nodes.

Especially relevant for healthcare, legal, finance, and government sectors.

MemoryKeep defines a graph-native memory architecture for persistent AI systems. By modeling memory as structured topology rather than unstructured text, enforcing strict token governance, incorporating deterministic reboot protocols, and integrating hybrid retrieval with confidence modeling, MemoryKeep enables reliable, explainable, long-term AI cognition.
As AI systems evolve from stateless responders to persistent agents, structured memory infrastructure becomes foundational.
MemoryKeep is a graph-native persistent cognitive memory system for LLM-based agents. It enforces bounded prompt context while enabling structured, relational, explainable long-term memory.
MemoryKeep transforms language models from stateless responders into persistent cognitive systems.
MemoryKeep is not a document store with embeddings.
It is a typed, provenance-aware, confidence-scored property graph with hybrid semantic-structural retrieval and deterministic operational controls.
Holds invariant identity, global directives, and system-level constraints.
Stored separately from graph for low-latency access
Represents active working memory while enforcing strict context boundaries.
This enforces safety margin for generation.
Never inject full nodes or subgraphs
Token governance is deterministic and economically protective.
All inbound content is processed through deterministic classification.
Writes are queued and executed asynchronously with idempotent guarantees.
"type": "Person | Event | Project | Claim | Preference | Pattern | Directive | Concept",
Each node and edge contains confidence score.
Low-confidence nodes excluded unless explicitly requested.
Restore latest session summary if needed
Deletion evaluates relationship impact before execution.
Graph DB: Neo4j / Amazon Neptune / TigerGraph
Batch Jobs: Pattern synthesis & confidence decay
Result: lower inference cost per interaction.
MemoryKeep operates as infrastructure, not augmentation.
